injuries.comment: Ball will be re-evaluated in two weeks with a left calf strain, per ESPN's Shams Charania.
Salaün is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Indiana.
Diabate is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Indiana.
Williams has suffered a season-ending torn ACL in his knee, sources told ESPN.
Bridges is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Indiana.
The Hornets said that Mann will remain sidelined for Saturday's (Nov. 30) game against the Hawks and is expected to be re-evaluated in two weeks.
Williams is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Milwaukee.

The Nets said on Monday (Nov. 25) that Bogdanovic continues to be limited in his rehab and doesn't have a return timetable. He can be considered out indefinitely for future contests, barring a return to full-contact practices.
Thomas will be out 3 to 4 weeks due to a left hamstring strain, per ESPN's Shams Charania.
New Orleans Pelicans star Brandon Ingram has suffered a significant low left ankle sprain and is sidelined indefinitely, sources tell ESPN
Williamson is not close to returning and remains without a timetable, Shams Charania of ESPN said during an appearance on NBA Today.
Green is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against San Antonio.
Theis is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against San Antonio.
Matkovic is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against San Antonio.
Alvarado is expected to miss six weeks due to a hamstring injury, Shams Charania of ESPN reports.
The Pelicans said Hawkins has been diagnosed with a lumbar spine annular fissure and will be re-assessed in approximately one week.
Coach Brain Keefe said that Bey doesn't have a return timetable, Varun Shankar of The Washington Post reports.
Sarr is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Brogdon is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Kispert is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Sarr is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Vukcevic is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Baldwin Jr. is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
George is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Memphis.
Bane is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Washington.
Kennard is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Washington.

Grizzlies head coach Taylor Jenkins said imaging on Edey's sprained left ankle was promising, but the rookie center is still being viewed as week-to-week, Damichael Cole of The Memphis Commercial Appeal reports.
Morant is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Washington.
The Grizzlies announced that Williams has been diagnosed with a Grade 3 right ankle sprain and will be re-evaluated in approximately four weeks.
The Grizzlies announced Jackson continues to progress well from offseason foot surgery and is expected to return to play in 6-8 weeks.
Portland announced Tuesday that Clingan will be re-evaluated in two weeks.
Henderson is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Los Angeles.
The Trail Blazers announced that Thybulle suffered a Grade 2 right ankle sprain while ramping up in an effort to return to the court and is expected to miss 3-6 weeks.
Reath is doubtful for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Los Angeles.
Camara is doubtful for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Los Angeles.
Williams III  is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Los Angeles.
Horford did not play in Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against the Grizzlies.
Hauser is did not return to Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against Memphis.
Mann will undergo surgery to repair his fractured left middle finger and will be re-evaluated in three weeks, according to Joey Linn of SI.com.
Dunn is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Houston.
Harden is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Houston.
Brown has a herniated disc and will be re-evaluated in two weeks, according to an independent NBA writer Justin Russo.
Leonard has been cleared to resume shooting work said head coach Tyronn Lue on Monday (Nov. 18), according to Tomer Azarly of ClutchPoints.com.
The Clippers announced that F P.J. Tucker won't be with the team for the time being, according to Joey Linn of SI.com.
Bamba is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Houston.
Payne is questionable for Monday's (Dec. 9) game against Toronto.
Towns is questionable for Monday's (Dec. 9) game against Toronto.
Robinson has not been cleared to begin basketball activities, with coach Tom Thibodeau noting that the big man is only shooting thus far, Steve Popper of Newsday reports.
Eason is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Clippers.
Tate is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Clippers.
VanVleet is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Clippers.
Banchero has been diagnosed with a torn right oblique and will be re-evaluated in 4-to-6 weeks, Shams Charania of ESPN reports.
The Magic have listed Isaac as OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Suns.
Magic star forward Franz Wagner has suffered a torn right oblique and is out indefinitely, sources tell ESPN. Wagner sustained the injury Friday night and will be re-evaluated in four weeks.
The Magic have listed Harris as Out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Suns.
Pacers head coach Rick Carlisle said on Sunday (Dec. 1) that Nesmith is still weeks away from returning to game action, Dustin Dopirak of The Indianapolis Star reports.

The Indiana Pacers announced C Isaiah Jackson has sustained a torn right Achilles tendon in Friday's (Nov. 1) game versus the Pelicans and will be out for the remainder of the season, per Shams Charania of ESPN.
Wiseman underwent successful surgery to repair a torn left Achilles on Thursday (Oct. 24), per Shams Charania of ESPN.
Pacers head coach Rick Carlisle said on Sunday (Nov. 24) that Sheppard will miss multiple weeks, Dustin Dopirak of The Indianapolis Star reports.
Thompson did not play in Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against the Knicks.

The Pistons said on Wednesday (Nov. 26) that Klintman will miss his 20th straight contest to begin the season due to a right calf injury. Until Detroit provides a timetable for his return, the rookie forward can be considered out indefinitely.
Hardy did not play in Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against the Raptors.
Exum is expected to miss three months after undergoing right wrist surgery, Shams Charania of ESPN reports.
Marshall did not play in Saturday (Dec. 7) game against the Raptors.
The Kings announced that Lyles has suffered a Grade 1 right calf strain and will re-evaluated in 3-4 weeks, Frankie Cartoscelli of KHTK Sactown Sports 1140 reports.
Carter was cleared to participate in unrestricted shooting drills Monday, Matt George of ABC 10 Sacramento reports.
Markkanen is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Sacramento.
Clarkson is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Sacramento.
Hendricks is expected to miss the remainder of the season after suffering a fractured right fibula and dislocated ankle in Monday's 110-102 loss to the Mavericks, Tim MacMahon of ESPN.com reports.
Filipowski is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Sacramento.
Okoro did not play in Saturday's (Dec. 7) game against the Hornets.
Bates underwent arthroscopic surgery to repair a torn meniscus in his right knee, Spencer Davies of SI.com reports.
Strus will be re-evaluated next week, Ethan Sands of Cleveland.com reported.
Porter Jr. is out for Sunday's (Dec. 8)game against Miami.
Dunn is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Orlando.
The Suns announced that Nurkic will be re-evaluated in one week due to a right thigh contusion, Duane Rankin of The Arizona Republic reports.
Gillespie suffered a right ankle fracture and will be re-evaluated in four weeks, Shane Young of Forbes.com reports.
Durant will be re-evaluated in one week with a left ankle sprain, per ESPN's Shams Charania.
Dillingham is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Golden State.
Ingles is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Golden State.
Bona is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Chicago.
Vassell did not play in Friday's (Dec. 6) game versus the Kings.
The Spurs have listed Wembanyama as Questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Pelicans.
Coach Mitch Johnson said that he expects Jones to miss at least a few weeks, Dusty Garza of News 4 San Antonio reports.
Brown is Out for Monday's (Dec. 9) game against New York.
Quickley isn't expected to be ready to return to game action until mid-December at the earliest, Josh Lewenberg of TSN.ca reports.
The Warriors have listed Wiggins as Questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Timberwolves.
Melton will undergo season-ending surgery on his left ACL, the team announced Wednesday (Nov. 20).
The Warriors have listed Moody as Questionable for Sunday's (Dec.8) game against the Timberwolves.
Dalen Terry (right knee) will not return to Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Philadelphia.
The Bulls said that Williams is out for Thursday's (Dec. 5) game against the Spurs and on Friday's game against the Pacers, per K.C. Johnson of NBC Sports Chicago.
Holmgren is expected to return during the 2024-25 season, and an update on his return-to-play protocol will be provided in eight-to-ten weeks.
Dieng will miss 3-4 weeks due to a right ring-finger fracture, Andrew Schlecht of The Athletic reports.
Williams irritated his right hamstring strain during a workout yesterday and will be re-evaluated in four to six weeks.
Topic underwent a successful left ACL procedure Wednesday and will miss the 2024-25 season, Clemente Almanza of USA Today reports.
The Hawks have listed Johnson as out for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against the Nuggets.

The Hawks announced on Wednesday (Nov. 26) Zeller has yet to play this season due to being away from the team. With there being no official timetable for the veteran big man's return, he can be considered out indefinitely.
DaRon Holmes II has suffered a torn right Achilles tendon, sources tell @TheAthletic @Stadium. He’s expected to miss the 2024-25 season.
Cancar will be re-evaluated in eight weeks following a left knee surgery, per Ryan Blackburn of MileHighSports.com.
Saric is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Atlanta.
Murray is OUT for Sunday's (Dec. 8) game against Atlanta.
Vanderbilt experienced fluid in his left knee recently during rehabilitation and is now targeting early January for a return.
James is questionable for Sunday's (Dec. 7) game against Portland.
Wood has experienced soreness in his surgically repaired left knee and will be re-evaluated in four weeks, Dan Woike of the Los Angeles Times reports.
Davis is probable for Sunday's (Dec. 7) game against Portland.
Reaves is doubtful for Sunday's (Dec. 7) game against Portland.
Hayes suffered a re-sprain of his right ankle and will miss two to three weeks, per ESPN's Shams Charania.
Larsson is OUT for Subnday's (Dec. 8) game against Cleveland.
